p: The difference in chemical composition and content for aromas was found among fresh, oven-dried, and freeze-dried black morels. As shown in Table 1, a total of sixty-five constituents were identified from three aroma samples, which can be divided into six types: aldehydes, ketones, alcohols, carboxylic acids/carboxylic acid derivatives, heterocycles/sulfurs, and others ( Table 2).
